Replace.Text: +20% [ICON_Production] Production in this city, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production for each Mine and Quarry in this city. Must be built along a River adjacent to an Industrial Zone district with a Factory.
Nothing is adversely affecting your relationship at this point in time.
View important information about your Access Level with this leader, including what kinds of Gossip you will have access to.
Greetings traveler. You should know that you stand in the presence of greatness.
[SIZE_16]Declare War of Liberation[NEWLINE][SIZE_12](No warmongering if liberating friendly cities)[NEWLINE]
[SIZE_16]Declare War of Reconquest[NEWLINE][SIZE_12](No warmongering if re-capturing your cities)[NEWLINE]
[SIZE_16]Declare Protectorate War[NEWLINE][SIZE_12](No warmongering if defending allied city-state)[NEWLINE]
[COLOR_Civ6Red]Denounce[ENDCOLOR]
That is too bad. I thought we were friends.
You have so few troops. Aren't you scared for your life?
Your cities are so close. Your troops are so strong. You are making me nervous!
Do you not realize that we are supposed to be the pre-eminent builders of wonders?
Your empire is headed toward bankruptcy. How can you survive with debt piling up?
{1_CivName} has just liberated {2_CityName}, giving it back to {3_CivName}.
{1_Num} = Amenities From Policies[NEWLINE]
Amenities from Policies:
Amenities lost from [COLOR_Civ6Red]War Weariness[ENDCOLOR]:
Amenities lost from [COLOR_Civ6Red]Bankruptcy[ENDCOLOR]:
Water {1_Water}, Buildings {2_Buildings}, Improvements {3_Improvements}, Neighborhoods {4_Districts}, Policies {5_Civics}
Housing from Buildings:
Housing from Policies:
Housing from Districts:
Housing from Improvements:
Housing from Water:
Cistern
Provides early [ICON_Housing] Housing in the City Center.
Water Treatment Plant
Provides late-game [ICON_Housing] Housing and [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in the City Center.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to [ICON_RESOURCE_COFFEE] Coffee, [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea, [ICON_RESOURCE_MARBLE] Marble, [ICON_RESOURCE_DIAMONDS] Diamonds, and [ICON_RESOURCE_JADE] Jade resources.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to [ICON_RESOURCE_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RESOURCE_TRUFFLES] Truffles, and [ICON_RESOURCE_IVORY] Ivory resources.

+25% combat experience for all land units trained in this city. +4 [ICON_Production] Production when building units in this city. +1 [ICON_Production] Production to [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron and [ICON_RESOURCE_NITER] Niter resources.
Bonus [ICON_Gold] Gold equal to the adjacency bonus of the Commercial district.

+25% combat experience for all melee and ranged land units trained in this city. +2 [ICON_Production] Production when building units in this city. +1 [ICON_Production] Production to [ICON_RESOURCE_COPPER] Copper resources.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Stable.
+15% [ICON_Culture] Culture in this city.

A building unique to Japan. Bonus [ICON_Production] Production equal to the adjacency bonus of the Industrial district. After researching the Electricity technology this building provides an additional +4 [ICON_Culture] Culture to its city.
Bonus [ICON_Production] Production equal to the adjacency bonus of the Industrial district.
A building unique to America. +15% [ICON_Culture] Culture in this city. +100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism pressure from this city towards other civilizations in the Modern era.

+1 [ICON_Food] Food to [ICON_RESOURCE_BANANAS] Bananas, [ICON_RESOURCE_CATTLE] Cattle, [ICON_RESOURCE_CITRUS] Citrus, [ICON_RESOURCE_DEER] Deer, [ICON_RESOURCE_RICE] Rice, [ICON_RESOURCE_SHEEP] Sheep, and [ICON_RESOURCE_WHEAT] Wheat resources.
+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food from sea resources.
A building unique to Arabia. Bonus [ICON_Science] Science equal to the adjacency bonus of the Campus district. Provides +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith to its city.
+25% combat experience for all land units trained in this city. Faster Corps and Army training. +6 [ICON_Production] Production when building units in this city.

Holds [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art. Bonus [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to the adjacency bonus of the Theater district. May not be built in a Theater Square district that already has an Archaeological Museum.

Holds [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts. Bonus [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to the adjacency bonus of the Theater district. May not be built in a Theater Square district that already has an Art Museum.
+15% [ICON_Science] Science in this city.

Faster Fleet and Armada training. +25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food from Coast and Ocean tiles.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production from sea resources.
Provides mid-game [ICON_Housing] Housing and [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in the City Center.

Allows the purchasing of Missionaries. Missionaries can only be purchased with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to [ICON_RESOURCE_STONE] Stone, [ICON_RESOURCE_INCENSE] Incense, and [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine resources.

+25% combat experience for all cavalry class units trained in this city. +2 [ICON_Production] Production when building units in this city. +1 [ICON_Production] Production to [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horse resources.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]May not be built in an Encampment district that already has a Barracks.
+25% combat experience for all naval units trained in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Coast and Ocean tiles.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food from sea resources.
+15% [ICON_Gold] Gold in this city.
Bonus [ICON_Science] Science equal to the adjacency bonus of the Campus district.
City must be adjacent to a River.

Bonus extends to each city center within 6 tiles.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to [ICON_RESOURCE_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RESOURCE_TRUFFLES] Truffles, and [ICON_RESOURCE_IVORY] Ivory resources.
+1 [ICON_Science] Science in every Campus district.
Additional +1 [ICON_Science] Science in every Campus district.
+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in every Holy Site district.
Additional +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith in every Holy Site district.
+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold in the [ICON_Capital] Capital.
+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold in every Commercial Hub district.
Additional +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold in every Commercial Hub district.
+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture in every Theater Square district.
Additional +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture in every Theater Square district.
+1 [ICON_Production] Production in every Industrial Zone district when producing wonders, buildings, and districts.
Additional +1 [ICON_Production] Production in every Industrial Zone district when producing wonders, buildings, and districts.
+{1_num} [ICON_Food] Food from the adjacent sea {1_Num : plural 1?resource; other?resources;}.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent City Center.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Entertainment Complex.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Neighborhood {1_Num : plural 1?district; other?districts;}.
+{1_num} [ICON_Gold] Gold from the adjacent Commercial Hub.

A district that provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Must be built adjacent to the City Center.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food to tiles up to two away.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Food] Food to Oases.

A district unique to Rome for city growth. Replaces the Aqueduct district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It provides this city with a source of fresh water from an adjacent River, Lake, Oasis, or Mountain. Cities that do not yet have existing fresh water receive up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have existing fresh water will instead get +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Must be built adjacent to the City Center. In either case, the Bath provides an additional bonus of +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity. Must be built adjacent to the City Center.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food to tiles up to two away.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Food] Food to Oases.
A district in your city for scientific endeavors.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Science] Science to [ICON_RESOURCE_MERCURY] Mercury and [ICON_RESOURCE_URANIUM] Uranium resources.

A district in your city specializing in finance and trade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to [ICON_RESOURCE_FURS] Furs, [ICON_RESOURCE_SALT] Salt, [ICON_RESOURCE_COTTON] Cotton, [ICON_RESOURCE_DYES] Dyes, [ICON_RESOURCE_SILK] Silk, [ICON_RESOURCE_SPICES] Spices, [ICON_RESOURCE_SUGAR] Sugar, [ICON_RESOURCE_TOBACCO] Tobacco, and [ICON_RESOURCE_SILVER] Silver resources.

A district in your city for military facilities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production to [ICON_RESOURCE_COPPER] Copper, [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron, [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] Horses, and [ICON_RESOURCE_NITER] Niter resources.

A district in your city dedicated to keeping your people happy by increasing [ICON_Amenities] Amenities.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to [ICON_RESOURCE_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RESOURCE_TRUFFLES] Truffles, and [ICON_RESOURCE_IVORY] Ivory resources.

A district unique to Brazil. Replaces the Entertainment Complex district, and provides +2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. Also unlocks the Carnival project, which grants an additional +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity when underway and a variety of [ICON_GreatPerson] Great People points once completed.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold to [ICON_RESOURCE_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RESOURCE_TRUFFLES] Truffles, and [ICON_RESOURCE_IVORY] Ivory resources.
A district in your city for religious worship.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith to [ICON_RESOURCE_STONE] Stone, [ICON_RESOURCE_INCENSE] Incense, and [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine resources.

A district unique to Russia for religious activity. Replaces the Holy Site district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Your city border grows by one tile each time a Great Person is expended in this city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Faith] Faith to [ICON_RESOURCE_STONE] Stone, [ICON_RESOURCE_INCENSE] Incense, and [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine resources.

A district for naval activity in your city. Also removes the [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile. Must be built on Coast or Lake Terrain adjacent to land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food from Coast and Ocean tiles.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.

A district unique to England for naval activity in your city. Replaces the Harbor district. Also removes the [ICON_Movement] Movement penalty for embarking and disembarking to and from this tile. Must be built on Coast or Lake Terrain adjacent to land.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for all naval units built in Dockyard.[NEWLINE]+2 [ICON_Gold] Gold when built on a foreign continent.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Food] Food from Coast and Ocean tiles.[NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.

A district in your city for industrial activity.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production to [ICON_RESOURCE_GYPSUM] Gypsum, [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum, [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal, and [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] Oil resources.

A district unique to Germany for industrial activity. Replaces the Industrial Zone district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Production] Production to [ICON_RESOURCE_GYPSUM] Gypsum, [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum, [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal, and [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] Oil resources.

A district in your city for cultural sites.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to [ICON_RESOURCE_COFFEE] Coffee, [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea, [ICON_RESOURCE_MARBLE] Marble, [ICON_RESOURCE_DIAMONDS] Diamonds, and [ICON_RESOURCE_JADE] Jade resources.

A district unique to Greece for cultural sites. Replaces the Theater Square district.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture to [ICON_RESOURCE_COFFEE] Coffee, [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea, and [ICON_RESOURCE_MARBLE] Marble resources.
+4 [ICON_Gold] Gold from Commercial Hub district buildings.
+3 [ICON_Culture] Culture from Theater Square district buildings.
+3 [ICON_Science] Science from Campus district buildings.
+50% Theater Square district adjacency bonuses.
+50% Industrial Zone adjacency bonuses.
+50% Commercial Hub and +100% Harbor district adjacency bonuses.
+50% Campus and Industrial Zone district adjacency bonuses.
+50% Campus district adjacency bonuses.
+50% Theater Square district adjacency bonuses, and Stadiums generate +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity.
+50% Commercial Hub district adjacency bonuses.
